projects.title: Escape from the Roots
projects.description: Project created for the Global Game Jam, whose theme was 'Roots'. It's a 2d horror game where the aim is to escape from the maze without getting caught by the roots.

projects.title: 42sh
projects.description: The project involves developing a UNIX command interpreter, similar to the TCSH shell. The aim is to be able to execute basic commands, handle errors, environment variables and built-in commands such as cd, setenv, unsetenv, env and exit. The interpreter must also manage the search for executables in the PATH and display a prompt to wait for user commands.

projects.title: MyHunter
projects.description: The project involves creating a small video game inspired by Duck Hunt. The player takes the role of a hunter who must shoot ducks that appear on the screen. The game must handle user input, display animated sprites and allow the player to move and shoot the ducks. The aim is to create a fun game while respecting the rules and functionalities required.

projects.title: Radar
projects.description: The project consists in developing an air traffic simulation. The program displays a 2D visualization panel where aircraft and control towers move according to predefined rules. Aircraft move in straight lines, taking off, landing and colliding, while control towers have circular control zones. The aim is to create a realistic simulation, respecting the required functionalities and allowing the user to interact with the visualization.

projects.title: BSQ
projects.description: The project involves finding the largest possible square on a grid, avoiding obstacles. The grid can be generated from a file or using parameters for width, height and a repeated pattern. The program must display the grid with the cells of the largest square replaced by 'x'. The aim is to find the highest solution and, in the case of several solutions, to choose the leftmost square.

projects.title: Sokoban
projects.description: The project involves developing a terminal-mode version of the Sokoban game using the ncurses library. The player has to move crates around a warehouse, pushing the crates to storage locations. The game is over when all the crates have been placed on the storage locations. The program must be able to handle the resizing of the terminal and the arrow keys for the player's movements.

projects.title: Antman
projects.description: The project involves the development of two programs, 'antman' and 'giantman', for compressing and decompressing files respectively. The aim is to implement a lossless compression algorithm to reduce file size while guaranteeing exact recovery of the original data during decompression. The programs have to take account of different file types, such as text files, HTML files and PPM images, and have to work efficiently even on large files.

projects.title: Push Swap
projects.description: The project consists in developing a program that sorts a list of numbers using a limited set of operations. The program will take as input an unsorted list and must produce a sequence of operations that sorts the list with the fewest possible operations. The aim is to implement an efficient algorithm to solve this sorting problem in an optimal way.

projects.title: Biker Neon
projects.description: A mobile video game inspired by the famous Rider game

projects.title: MyPaint
projects.description: The project involves developing a drawing program similar to 'Paint' using a graphical user interface. The program is to enable the user to draw using tools such as pencil and eraser, and to modify the parameters of these tools. It should also offer features such as image saving in different formats.

projects.title: MyRpg
projects.description: The project involves creating a complete role-playing game (RPG) using the C language. The game must offer a pleasant user interface, a coherent universe with appropriate graphics and sounds, and a fun gameplay experience with objectives to achieve. It must also include player features, combat, inventory, quests, and allow the player to gain experience and progress through the game.

projects.title: Dante's Star
projects.description: The project involves generating mazes, finding the exit path and solving the mazes as quickly as possible. The project also includes performance measurement and optimization of the algorithms used.

projects.title: Lem-in
projects.description: The project involves simulating a computer called 'Hex', which functions like an anthill with rooms and tunnels. The aim is to find the fastest way to get the ants from the entrance to the exit of this virtual anthill, avoiding traffic jams and taking the shortest route.

projects.title: Need4Stek
projects.description: The project consists in creating an autonomous car using Lidar, capable of driving on a virtual track without hitting walls or driving in the wrong direction. The aim is to develop high-performance artificial intelligence to control the car using the CoppeliaSim simulator.

projects.title: Popeye
projects.description: The project involves containerizing and deploying a web survey application. The aim is to master the basics of containerization and describe a multi-container infrastructure using Docker and Docker Compose.

projects.title: Chocolatine
projects.description: The project involves setting up a workflow with GitHub Actions to apply best practices and various rules in a code repository. The aim is to automate the process of code style verification, program compilation and test execution.

projects.title: Todo Manager
projects.description: The project involves creating a web-based task management application. The aim is to master the basics of React and create a REST API using FastAPI.

projects.title: GameZen
projects.description: GameZen is a plugin that automatically activates Do Not Disturb mode on Discord when a game is launched. It aims to provide an uninterrupted gaming experience by automatically adjusting the user's status. This allows users to concentrate fully on their game without being disturbed by unwanted notifications or messages.

projects.title: Corewar
projects.description: Corewar is a game project in which several programs called Champions fight to be the last alive. It's a computer simulation where processors share memory for execution. The aim of the project is to create a virtual machine in which Champions fight for memory, and the last Champion to execute the live instruction is declared the winner.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: This project is a website portfolio made to present my computer science projects. It is a one-page responsive website programmed with React, HTML, CSS, and TypeScript
